resource.name: geometrically_bounded_2d_wireframe
resource.keywords: bounded, curve, point, 2D wireframe, application interpreted construct.

abstract.p: This document specifies the use of ISO 10303 integrated resources satisfying the requirements for the representation as a consistent set of geometric and topological entities for the definition of wireframe models described by points and curves.

purpose.p: This document specifies the application interpreted construct for the description of a geometric shape by means of two-dimensional geometrically bounded wireframe models.
The second edition of this part of ISO 10303 incorporates modifications that are upwardly compatible with the first edition. Modifications to EXPRESS specifications are upwardly compatible if:

ul.li: the mapping tables of ISO 10303 application protocols based on the previous edition of this part of ISO 10303 remain valid in a revision of that application protocol based on this edition of this part of ISO 10303.

purpose.p: Technical modifications to the first edition of this part of ISO 10303 are categorised as follows: changes to the EXPRESS declarations, new EXPRESS declarations, and changes to definitions of EXPRESS entity data types.
The following aic_geometrically_bounded_2d_wireframe EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been modified:

scope.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies the interpretation of the integrated resources to satisfy requirements for the representation of the product shape using two-dimensional geometrically bounded wireframe models.
The following are within the scope of this part of ISO 10303:

ul.li: points defined in a two-dimensional coordinate space;
curves defined in a two-dimensional coordinate space that are trimmed by points and curves;
curves defined in a two-dimensional coordinate space that are self-intersecting;
the representation of a single wireframe model or an assembly of wireframe models.

outscope.li: geometry defined in a three-dimensional coordinate space;
curves that are not trimmed and that are not self-intersecting.

schema.name: aic_geometrically_bounded_2d_wireframe
schema.introduction: This part of ISO 10303 provides the geometric structures to represent two-dimensional shapes and is represented by the entity geometrically_bounded_2d_wireframe_representation, that is a shape_representation (see ISO 10303-41).
schema.fund_cons: This wireframe representation of shape is based on two-dimensional geometry where unbounded curves are trimmed by points. The shapes represented by the geometrically_bounded_2d_wireframe_representation are those requiring only bounded curves.
